Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

ListItem.name: LI_937368
ListItem.title: Skin, subcutaneous tissues, soft tissues including muscle and / or non-regional lymph nodes

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937186
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_937186_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937277
DisplayedItem.title: In general, CAP cancer protocol case summaries are intended to guide reporting on the specimen that the pathologist is evaluating at that time. However, melanoma cases frequently include multiple procedures. Because of this, a prior procedure that was performed may affect the pathologic classification of the tumor. In order to represent this appropriately in the pathology report, information from prior procedures may be incorporated into the assignment of pathologic classification if it is available. When information from a prior procedure is included in this report, details of that procedure should be documented in the report as well.

ListItem.name: LI_938267
ListItem.title: No information from a prior procedure is included in the classification assigned in this report

ListItem.name: LI_937271
ListItem.title: Classification assigned in this report includes information from a prior procedure (explain)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_937271_1
Property.val: Classification assigned in this report includes information from a prior procedure

ListItem.name: LI_937279
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_937090
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor (e.g., unknown primary or completely regressed melanoma)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937276
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Melanoma 1.0 mm or less in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified (Note D)

ListItem.name: LI_937100
ListItem.title: pT1a: Melanoma less than 0.8 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_937091
ListItem.title: pT1b: Melanoma less than 0.8 mm in thickness with ulceration; or Melanoma 0.8 to 1.0 mm in thickness with or without ulceration

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937260
DisplayedItem.title: pT2: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified

ListItem.name: LI_937101
ListItem.title: pT2a: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_937102
ListItem.title: pT2b: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937300
DisplayedItem.title: pT3: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified

ListItem.name: LI_937092
ListItem.title: pT3a: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_937093
ListItem.title: pT3b: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937267
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified

ListItem.name: LI_937103
ListItem.title: pT4a: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_937104
ListItem.title: pT4b: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_937517
ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937273
DisplayedItem.title: # pN1b, 2b, and 3b subcategories are dependent on clinical information that may be unavailable to the pathologist. If this information is not available, the parent category (pN1, pN2 or pN3) should be selected.

ListItem.name: LI_937281
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_937282
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_937094
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis detected

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937251
DisplayedItem.title: pN1: One tumor-involved node or in-transit, satellite, and / or microsatellite metastases with no tumor-involved nodes

ListItem.name: LI_937095
ListItem.title: pN1a: One clinically occult tumor-involved node (i.e., detected by sentinel node biopsy) with no in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases

ListItem.name: LI_937105
ListItem.title: pN1b: One clinically detected tumor-involved node with no in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases#

ListItem.name: LI_937107
ListItem.title: pN1c: Presence of in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases with no regional lymph node disease

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937270
DisplayedItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in two to three regional nodes or in-transit, satellite, and / or microsatellite with one tumor-involved node

ListItem.name: LI_937096
ListItem.title: pN2a: Two to three clinically occult tumor-involved nodes (i.e., detected by sentinel node biopsy) with no in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases

ListItem.name: LI_937106
ListItem.title: pN2b: Two to three tumor-involved nodes at least one of which was clinically detected with no in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases#

ListItem.name: LI_937080
ListItem.title: pN2c: One clinically occult or clinically detected tumor-involved node with presence of in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937272
DisplayedItem.title: pN3: Metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes, or in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases with two or more tumor-involved nodes or any number of matted nodes with or without in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases

ListItem.name: LI_937108
ListItem.title: pN3a: Four or more clinically occult tumor-involved nodes (i.e., detected by sentinel node biopsy) with no in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases

ListItem.name: LI_937097
ListItem.title: pN3b: Four or more tumor-involved nodes, at least one of which was clinically detected, with no in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases#

ListItem.name: LI_937109
ListItem.title: pN3c: Two or more clinically occult or clinically detected tumor-involved nodes with in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases and / or any number of matted nodes with in-transit, satellite and / or microsatellite metastases

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937250
DisplayedItem.title: AJCC suffixes for M category: (0) LDH not elevated, (1) LDH elevated, are not included in the surgical pathology report. LDH levels, as with other clinical parameters, may be included in the final classification by clinicians with access to this data.

ListItem.name: LI_937153
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_937153_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937221
DisplayedItem.title: pM1: Evidence of distant metastasis (documented in this specimen)

ListItem.name: LI_937110
ListItem.title: pM1a: Distant metastasis in skin (including subcutaneous tissues), soft tissues including muscle and / or nonregional lymph node

ListItem.name: LI_937111
ListItem.title: pM1b: Distant metastasis to lung with or without M1a sites of disease

ListItem.name: LI_937112
ListItem.title: pM1c: Distant metastasis to non-CNS visceral sites with or without M1a or M1b sites of disease

ListItem.name: LI_937081
ListItem.title: pM1d: Distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937435
DisplayedItem.title: For molecular genetic reporting, the CAP Melanoma Biomarker Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
